On Sun, 28 Sep 2003, trz wrote:

> Jim Dixon wrote:
> > I haven't done any real testing, but my impression is that overall
> > Java performs like Perl.  The development environment is wonderful,
> > the code is much easier to debug, the language itself is clear and
> > almost entirely free of the weirdnesses that characterize Perl.  But
> > it's slow.

> there are around several java vs c/c++ benchmarks from different sources.

I'm sure that there are.

> The typical result is that latest jdk (1.4) are 30%-100% slower than
> c/c++ code.

100% slower?  You mean, I assume, that when you run C++ the Java is too
embarassed to run at all?

> It depends a lot on the code run, the jvm impl (ibm vs sun, ecc.) and on
> the c/c++ compiler (MS vs gcc, ecc.), what I report is just a "mean" value.
>
> These are commonly accepted results. To say that java (1.4) is 30 times
> slower is simply false (was true for old jdk).

I do believe that what I said was that on the particular test that I was
running, Perl (_Perl_, not Java (1.4 or whatever)) was 30 times slower.

Whether this was "commonly accepted" is irrelevant.  What matters is
what happens when you run the tests.
